metadata.title: CVE-2022-31088 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
LDAP Account Manager (LAM) is a webfrontend for managing entries (e.g.users, groups, DHCP settings) stored in an LDAP directory. In versionsprior to 8.0 the user name field at login could be used to enumerate LDAPdata. This is only the case for LDAP search configuration. This issue hasbeen fixed in version 8.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31088` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-account-manager - 8.0.1-1
ldap-account-manager-lamdaemon - 8.0.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ldap-account-manager package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.1-1').
